objtitle.title: Academy Study: Standing Male Nude Seen from Behind

provenance.name: British Museum
provenance.note: Acquired at an unknown time by John Deffett Francis and given by him to the British Museum in Dec. 1874.

desc.objtitle:
Academy Study: Standing Male Nude Seen from Behind,
object 1 (Butlin 72 recto)

objnote.p: For the pencil sketch on the verso of this drawing, see Standing and Seated Figures, Possibly a Drawing Class in the Royal Academy.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Seen from behind, a single nude figure stands in the center of this drawing. A muscular male, the figure raises both arms vertically with elbows slightly bent. Though he faces away, he turns his head up and to the right, allowing the viewer to see his facial profile. His mouth may be open. He may be bald or, alternatively, his hair may be unarticulated (similar to his unfinished hands). His buttocks are prominent, and he stands in an exaggerated contrapposto position with right leg bent forward and right foot slightly raised. This drawing is likely an academic study of the nude male form.

component.illusobjdesc: Seen from behind, a single nude figure stands in the center of this drawing. A muscular male, the figure raises both arms vertically with elbows slightly bent.
